title: Pity me not - situation at end of poem

content.prompt: Which of the following statements best describes the speaker’s situation at the end of the poem?

choices.label: She is upset about her lover’s infidelity.
She is anguished by the passage of time.
She is aware that her feelings are not in accord with her reason.
She is dismissive of emotions that she believes she has transcended.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
